headline: Lived History: A Message Across Time
description: A meditation on digital memory and the strange intimacy of mundane records. This post explores hyperlink decay, AI usage, and how we imagine future readers encountering our lives.
resonantThread: how the ordinary becomes the record
whyItMatters: This post suggests that even dry, transactional digital moments might outlive their authors. It leans into the idea that preservation is not about importance — it’s about presence, timing, and curiosity.
articleExcerpt: It makes writing more fun when you imagine your work being stumbled on a thousand years from now.
sourceFragments: Anything is historical data after a long enough time.
